title: เทคโนโลยีเพาะเลี้ยงเซลล์เนื้อเยื่อกระดูกอ่อน
description: Currently, the cell sheet engineering is one of the most dynamic and large-scaled researches which will later have a major impact on both the patient’s treatment methods and the medical treatment costs. In recent years, cell sheet engineering has received much attention as a new approach to cure cartilage defects in the knees without the use of scaffold. Assoc. Prof. Kwanchanok, and a dynamic researcher team, introduce the technology which promises to help lessen pain, as well as, the costs by replacing the traditional medical treatment, the titanium scaffold insertion, with the new technology. The new method will require the cell sheet to be transplanted directly onto the damaged cartilage which will gradually grow and restore its damaged predecessor allowing the patient to resume their usual life.

speaker.name: Kwanchanok Pasuwat
speaker.bio: Assoc. Prof. Kwanchanok Pasuwat is a lecturer and biological engineering researcher. Interested in researches specifically the field of engineering cooperated with biology to improve the quality of patient treatment in any cases.
